result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A Mikulance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas A Mikulance

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
On a plea to the charge, State moves to remove the repeater enhancer.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.   Repeater enhancer dismissed.
cfts;
cc are waived.

Status conference on March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim, JR (person, property, residence or family).    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Thomas A Mikulance in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
